p: The hypoglycemic effects of S. dulcificum fruit (50% and 100%) and leaf (50% and 100%) extracts on the blood glucose level of alloxan-induced diabetic albino rats was reported by Dioso et al. (2016). Both the fruits and the leaves of S. dulcificum showed significant hypoglycaemic effect. It was suggested that the observed effect could be due to miraculin and other phytochemicals such as flavonoids and saponins present in the plant.
